home.name: House of Sacrifices
description:
by Brent Irwin
This game was initially developed as a class project. It was written in C++ for the UNIX command line. I was proud of it, but it was hard to share with my friends and family. I ported this game into JavaScript with React to solve that problem.
The story was inspired by the free Dungeons & Dragons adventure, Death House.

You find yourself in an eerie old town. The cobblestone streets are narrow and the tall buildings seem to cave in above you.
You hear a whimpering coming from a dark alley. You go to investigate adn find a small boy and girl crying outside of a dilapidated house with boarded windows. You ask what is wrong.
The boy is too frightened to talk. The girl speaks up. "We cannot go back inside," she says. "Our parents keep a monster in the basement, and they're not here. Please, our baby brother is trapped inside his room."
"Please, save our brother and stop the monster!" the small boy says.

foyer.description: You pass through the wrought iron gate and stare up at the tall house leaning over you. The door is already open. You walk inside and the heavy door slams behidn you. You try to get back out, but it is locked. You are trapped. Inside you see a tall grandfather clock. It chimes eleven times. To the west is a staircase. To the north and to the east are two closed doors.

conditions.description: You return to the vaulted, gothic foyer. The exit door is sealed shut. You see a tall grandfather clock. To the west is a staircase. To the north and to the east are two closed doors.

soft_links.action: The clock seems to be watching you. It dongs knowingly as you approach.

links.text: Take the door to the north.
Take the door to the east.

attic_just_discovered_chimney.description:
You enter an old unfinished attic. The floorboards creak, and a small trickle of water falls from a spot in the roof. With improper insulation, this attic is colder than the rest of the house. You see rain fall in the darkness beyond the cast iron bars on the windows. A dollhouse sits on the floor. On the bed are two small skeletons, dressed just like the children you met outside.
Leaning over the skeletons, you find that they are indeed wearing the same clothes as the children you met outside. They are the same sizes, too.
"You found us." You hear a voice from behind. You turn around to see the ghosts of Rose and Thorn.
Rose begins to speak. "Our parents sometimes lock us in our room to protect us from the monster. They say they have to keep it in the basement so that it won't escape and eat us. One day they locked us up here, and they never let us out. We heard the screams coming from the cellar every day, but we were left in here to starve. You have to slay the monster to free our souls from this curse, so that we may move on."
Thorn walks over to the dollhouse and speaks for the first time. "The fireplace in here conceals a secret path to the cellar. Please go down and save us." He reveals in the dollhouse that the chimneyway running the entire height of the house is indeed a narrow staircase. As he does so, the fireplace in the room slides open and reveals a dark passage downward.
With this, the children disappear before your eyes.

nursery.name: GAME OVER
nursery.description:
You thought you could outrun her twice? Think again. Or don't, because you're dead.
The ghoul grabs you by the throat. You feel her icy cold fingers sqeezing tight. You smell rotting flesh and struggle for breath as the nursemaid opens her mouth and chews into your face.

sword.name: GAME OVER
sword.description: You attempt to stab the ghoul with the sword, but it passes through it. You lean forward into the hideous creature. It grabs the sword itself and stabs you in the stomach. You fall on the ground bleeding as the nursemaid eats away your flesh.
